author: gstein
msg: Adjust revert 17 a little bit to compensate for new behavior in wc-ng,
according to errata wc003.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/revert_tests.py:
(status_of_missing_dir_after_revert_replaced_with_history_dir):
after the reverse-merge, the original A/D/G@1 is now copied into the
working copy. the children are recorded as individual copies by the
merge, but wc-ng coalesces them (per wc003), so they appear as a
single copy and the children are not mentioned. however, there are
still some problems with the wc-ng emulate of the old entries stuff,
and this test does not (yet) pass. some additional comments and code
org were made for future discrepancies that will probably arise in the
'svn revert' output.

author: gstein
msg: Our copyfrom deconstruction code relied on an entry's revision being
"correctly" set when it decided to remove an extra copyfrom record.
However, we altered the conditions around setting the revision in r36909
and that had an unintended ripple effect.
This clarifies a bunch of comments, and properly rewrites the entry into a
mixed-revision node.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c:
(read_entries): ensure we set entry->revision when we elide copyfrom
records to emulate the old mixed-rev copied subtrees.

author: hwright
msg: Fix another set of wc-ng test failures.  This patch creates a couple of new
test failures, but it is correct, and the net number of failures is
decreasing.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_tests.py
(test_list): Unmark merge test 91 as passing with wc-ng.  As our emulation
of the original svn_wc_entry_t struct gets better, we can expect the
same failures as wc-1.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c
(read_entries): Only clobber the revision with the original revision if
we don't already have a revision recorded.

author: pburba
msg: On the subtree-mergeinfo branch: Remove some development cruft that
accidentally got in via r36880.

author: hwright
msg: Merge r36783 from trunk:
Dereference a pointer to a svn_revnum_t to check if it's a valid
revision.
Justification:
Thorugh sheer luck it doesn't appear that this can cause any problems,
see http://svn.haxx.se/dev/archive-2009-03/0746.shtml, but it is
clearly wrong.
Votes:
+1: pburba, blair, stylesen
